visualize_outliers.py¶

visualize_outliers.visualize_outliers(data_df, outlier_df, bars=True, diff_colors=True, show=True, save=False, title='')¶
Parameters

  • data_df – A DataFrame which holds all of the data we will be detecting outliers in

  • outlier_df – A DataFrame which holds all of the outliers that have been separated from the main data set

  • bars – A boolean which determines whether or not we will use bars on either side of the data to highlight outliers

  • diff_colors – A boolean which is whether or not we will use different colors to represent outliers

  • show – A boolean of whether or not to show the plot (primarily used for testing)

  • save – A boolean of whether or not to save the plot

  • title – A String title to use for the plot

Returns

None

Visualizes the outliers.

visualize_outliers.visualize_outliers_1d(data_df, outlier_df, column, bars=True, diff_colors=True, show=True, save=False, title='')¶
Parameters

  • data_df – A DataFrame which holds all of the data we will be detecting outliers in

  • outlier_df – A DataFrame which holds all of the outliers that have been separated from the main data set

  • column – The DataFrame column we are visualizing

  • bars – A boolean which determines whether or not we will use bars on either side of the data to highlight outliers

  • diff_colors – A boolean which is whether or not we will use different colors to represent outliers

  • show – A boolean of whether or not to show the plot (primarily used for testing)

  • save – A boolean of whether or not to save the plot

  • title – A String title to use for the plot

Returns

None

Visualizes the outliers.

visualize_outliers.visualize_outliers_2d(data_df, outlier_df, diff_colors=True, show=True, save=False, title='')¶
Parameters

  • data_df – A DataFrame which holds all of the data we will be detecting outliers in

  • outlier_df – A DataFrame which holds all of the outliers that have been separated from the main data set

  • diff_colors – A boolean which is whether or not we will use different colors to represent outliers

  • show – A boolean of whether or not to show the plot (primarily used for testing)

  • save – A boolean of whether or not to save the plot

  • title – A String title to use for the plot

Returns

None

Visualizes the outliers.

visualize_outliers.visualize_outliers_grid(data_df, outlier_df, x_df, y_df, bars=True, diff_colors=True)¶
Parameters

  • data_df – A DataFrame which holds all of the data we will be detecting outliers in

  • outlier_df – A DataFrame which holds all of the outliers that have been separated from the main data set

  • bars – A boolean which determines whether or not we will use bars on either side of the data to highlight outliers

  • diff_colors – A boolean which is whether or not we will use different colors to represent outliers

Returns

None

Visualizes the outliers.
